summary: This bill, the Reducing Accidents In Locomotives Act (RAIL Act), aims to enhance railroad safety, particularly concerning the transportation of hazardous materials. It mandates new regulations for hazardous materials transport, including advance notification, route analysis, and safety recommendations. It also addresses inspection requirements, defect detectors, civil penalties, tank car standards, and hazardous material training for first responders. A key provision addresses freight train crew size, mandating a 2-person crew for most Class I railroads, with exceptions defined. The bill seeks to improve overall rail safety and reduce the risk of accidents.
